description: A podcast about life and politics on the African continent

items.content: “Few were surprised as, near midnight on August 26, the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission announced incumbent president Emmerson Mnangagwa’s reelection in yet another of Zimbabwe’s tendentious contests,” writes David B. Moore. “His inauguration on September 4 sanctified his return to power.” In this article by Moore, first published in The Conversation Africa, he explains how the Read More...

items.content: Aisha Namugga, Bashiru Koroma, and Louise Tekapso are climate experts from across the continent—Uganda, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon, respectively. We spoke with them about their expertise in climate change and sustainable environments while they were at Cornell University this summer completing the Mandela Washington Fellowship for Young African Leaders (YALI). The fellows discussed their vision Read More...

items.content: A three-day protest in Accra, Ghana, in late September addressed the economic strife faced by Ghanaians. Demonstrators were met with large numbers of arrests and push back from police. In today’s episode, – the launch of season 8! – our graduate podcast fellow Ami Tamakloe speaks with three guests who were involved with the protests: Read More...

items.content: E. Tendayi Achiume is a professor of law at UCLA and a newly announced 2023 MacArthur Fellow.
